text: Edmund ’s first object the next morning was to see his father alone , and give him a fair statement of the whole acting scheme , defending his own share in it as far only as he could then , in a soberer moment , feel his motives to deserve , and acknowledging , with perfect ingenuousness , that his concession had been attended with such partial good as to make his judgment in it very doubtful .
text_tokenized: Edmund ’s first object the next morning was to see his father alone , and give him a fair statement of the whole acting scheme , defending his own share in it as far only as he could then , in a soberer moment , feel his motives to deserve , and acknowledging , with perfect ingenuousness , that his concession had been attended with such partial good as to make his judgment in it very doubtful .

text: He was anxious , while vindicating himself , to say nothing unkind of the others : but there was only one amongst them whose conduct he could mention without some necessity of defence or palliation .
text_tokenized: He was anxious , while vindicating himself , to say nothing unkind of the others : but there was only one amongst them whose conduct he could mention without some necessity of defence or palliation .

text: “ We have all been more or less to blame , ” said he , “ every one of us , excepting Fanny .
text_tokenized: “ We have all been more or less to blame , ” said he , “ every one of us , excepting Fanny .

text: Fanny is the only one who has judged rightly throughout ; who has been consistent .
text_tokenized: Fanny is the only one who has judged rightly throughout ; who has been consistent .

text: _ Her _ feelings have been steadily against it from first to last .
text_tokenized: _ Her _ feelings have been steadily against it from first to last .

text: She never ceased to think of what was due to you .
text_tokenized: She never ceased to think of what was due to you .

text: You will find Fanny everything you could wish .
text_tokenized: You will find Fanny everything you could wish .

text: Sir Thomas saw all the impropriety of such a scheme among such a party , and at such a time , as strongly as his son had ever supposed he must ; he felt it too much , indeed , for many words ; and having shaken hands with Edmund , meant to try to lose the disagreeable impression , and forget how much he had been forgotten himself as soon as he could , after the house had been cleared of every object enforcing the remembrance , and restored to its proper state .
text_tokenized: Sir Thomas saw all the impropriety of such a scheme among such a party , and at such a time , as strongly as his son had ever supposed he must ; he felt it too much , indeed , for many words ; and having shaken hands with Edmund , meant to try to lose the disagreeable impression , and forget how much he had been forgotten himself as soon as he could , after the house had been cleared of every object enforcing the remembrance , and restored to its proper state .

text: He did not enter into any remonstrance with his other children : he was more willing to believe they felt their error than to run the risk of investigation .
text_tokenized: He did not enter into any remonstrance with his other children : he was more willing to believe they felt their error than to run the risk of investigation .

text: The reproof of an immediate conclusion of everything , the sweep of every preparation , would be sufficient .
text_tokenized: The reproof of an immediate conclusion of everything , the sweep of every preparation , would be sufficient .

text: There was one person , however , in the house , whom he could not leave to learn his sentiments merely through his conduct .
text_tokenized: There was one person , however , in the house , whom he could not leave to learn his sentiments merely through his conduct .

text: He could not help giving Mrs. Norris a hint of his having hoped that her advice might have been interposed to prevent what her judgment must certainly have disapproved .
text_tokenized: He could not help giving Mrs. Norris a hint of his having hoped that her advice might have been interposed to prevent what her judgment must certainly have disapproved .

text: Mrs. Norris was a little confounded and as nearly being silenced as ever she had been in her life ; for she was ashamed to confess having never seen any of the impropriety which was so glaring to Sir Thomas , and would not have admitted that her influence was insufficient — that she might have talked in vain .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Norris was a little confounded and as nearly being silenced as ever she had been in her life ; for she was ashamed to confess having never seen any of the impropriety which was so glaring to Sir Thomas , and would not have admitted that her influence was insufficient — that she might have talked in vain .

text: Her only resource was to get out of the subject as fast as possible , and turn the current of Sir Thomas ’s ideas into a happier channel . She had a great deal to insinuate in her own praise as to _ general _ attention to the interest and comfort of his family , much exertion and many sacrifices to glance at in the form of hurried walks and sudden removals from her own fireside , and many excellent hints of distrust and economy to Lady Bertram and Edmund to detail , whereby a most considerable saving had always arisen , and more than one bad servant been detected .
text_tokenized: Her only resource was to get out of the subject as fast as possible , and turn the current of Sir Thomas ’s ideas into a happier channel . text: But her chief strength lay in Sotherton .
text_tokenized: But her chief strength lay in Sotherton .

text_tokenized: Her greatest

text: support and glory was in having formed the connexion with the Rushworths .

text: She took to herself all the credit of bringing Mr. Rushworth ’s admiration of Maria to any effect .
text_tokenized: She took to herself all the credit of bringing Mr. Rushworth ’s admiration of Maria to any effect .

text: “ If I had not been active , ” said she , “ and made a point of being introduced to his mother , and then prevailed on my sister to pay the first visit , I am as certain as I sit here that nothing would have come of it ; for Mr. Rushworth is the sort of amiable modest young man who wants a great deal of encouragement , and there were girls enough on the catch for him if we had been idle .

text: I was ready to move heaven and earth to persuade my sister , and at last I did persuade her .

text: I thought we should never have got through them , though we had the four horses of course ; and poor old coachman would attend us , out of his great love and kindness , though he was hardly able to sit the box on account of the rheumatism which I had been doctoring him for ever since Michaelmas .

text: this was such a day , I could not help going to him up in his room before we set off to advise him not to venture : he was putting on his wig ; so I said , ‘ Coachman , you had much better not go ; your Lady and I shall be very safe ; you know how steady Stephen is , and Charles has been upon the leaders so often now , that I am sure there is no fear .

text: Sir Thomas gave up the point , foiled by her evasions , disarmed by her flattery ; and was obliged to rest satisfied with the conviction that where the present pleasure of those she loved was at stake , her kindness did sometimes overpower her judgment .

text: It was a busy morning with him .
text_tokenized: It was a busy morning with him .

text: Conversation with any of them occupied but a small part of it .

text: He had to reinstate himself in all the wonted concerns of his Mansfield life : to see his steward and his bailiff ; to examine and compute , and , in the intervals of business , to walk into his stables and his gardens , and nearest plantations ; but active and methodical , he had not only done all this before he resumed his seat as master of the house at dinner , he had also set the carpenter to work in pulling down what had been so lately put up in the billiard - room , and given the scene - painter his dismissal long enough to justify the pleasing belief of his being then at least as far off as Northampton .
text_tokenized: He had to reinstate himself in all the wonted concerns of his Mansfield life : to see his steward and his bailiff ; to examine and compute , and , in the intervals of business , to walk into his stables and his gardens , and nearest plantations ; but active and methodical , he had not only done all this before he resumed his seat as master of the house at dinner , he had also set the carpenter to work in pulling down what had been so lately put up in the billiard - room , and given the scene - painter his dismissal long enough to justify the pleasing belief of his being then at least as far off as Northampton .

text: The scene - painter was gone , having spoilt only the floor of one room , ruined all the coachman ’s sponges , and made five of the under - servants idle and dissatisfied ; and Sir Thomas was in hopes that another day or two would suffice to wipe away every outward memento of what had been , even to the destruction of every unbound copy of Lovers ’ Vows in the house , for he was burning all that met his eye .
text_tokenized: The scene - painter was gone , having spoilt only the floor of one room , ruined all the coachman ’s sponges , and made five of the under - servants idle and dissatisfied ; and Sir Thomas was in hopes that another day or two would suffice to wipe away every outward memento of what had been , even to the destruction of every unbound copy of Lovers ’ Vows in the house , for he was burning all that met his eye .

text: Mr. Yates was beginning now to understand Sir Thomas ’s intentions , though as far as ever from understanding their source .
text_tokenized: Mr. Yates was beginning now to understand Sir Thomas ’s intentions , though as far as ever from understanding their source .

text: He and his friend had been out with their guns the chief of the morning , and Tom had taken the opportunity of explaining , with proper apologies for his father ’s particularity , what was to be expected .

text: To be a second time disappointed in the same way was an instance of very severe ill - luck ; and his indignation was such , that had it not been for delicacy towards his friend , and his friend ’s youngest sister , he believed he should certainly attack the baronet on the absurdity of his proceedings , and argue him into a little more rationality .

text_tokenized: which made Mr. Yates think it wiser to let him pursue his own way , and feel the folly of it without opposition .

text: He had known many disagreeable fathers before , and often been struck with the inconveniences they occasioned , but never , in the whole course of his life , had he seen one of that class so unintelligibly moral , so infamously tyrannical as Sir Thomas .
text_tokenized: He had known many disagreeable fathers before , and often been struck with the inconveniences they occasioned , but never , in the whole course of his life , had he seen one of that class so unintelligibly moral , so infamously tyrannical as Sir Thomas .

text: He was not a man to be endured but for his children ’s sake , and he might be thankful to his fair daughter Julia that Mr. Yates did yet mean to stay a few days longer under his roof .
text_tokenized: He was not a man to be endured but for his children ’s sake , and he might be thankful to his fair daughter Julia that Mr. Yates did yet mean to stay a few days longer under his roof .

text: The evening passed with external smoothness , though almost every mind was ruffled ; and the music which Sir Thomas called for from his daughters helped to conceal the want of real harmony .

text: Maria was in a good deal of agitation .
text_tokenized: Maria was in a good deal of agitation .

text: It was of the utmost consequence to her that Crawford should now lose no time in declaring himself , and she was disturbed that even a day should be gone by without seeming to advance that point .
text_tokenized: It was of the utmost consequence to her that Crawford should now lose no time in declaring himself , and she was disturbed that even a day should be gone by without seeming to advance that point .

text: She had been expecting to see him the whole morning , and all the evening , too , was still expecting him .
text_tokenized: She had been expecting to see him the whole morning , and all the evening , too , was still expecting him .

text: Mr. Rushworth had set off early with the great news for Sotherton ; and she had fondly hoped for such an immediate _ eclaircissement _ as might save him the trouble of ever coming back again .
text_tokenized: Mr. Rushworth had set off early with the great news for Sotherton ; and she had fondly hoped for such an immediate _ eclaircissement _ as might save him the trouble of ever coming back again .

text: But they had seen no one from the Parsonage , not a creature , and had heard no tidings beyond a friendly note of congratulation and inquiry from Mrs. Grant to Lady Bertram .
text_tokenized: But they had seen no one from the Parsonage , not a creature , and had heard no tidings beyond a friendly note of congratulation and inquiry from Mrs. Grant to Lady Bertram .

text: It was the first day for many , many weeks , in which the families had been wholly divided .
text_tokenized: It was the first day for many , many weeks , in which the families had been wholly divided .

text: Four - and - twenty hours had never passed before , since August began , without bringing them together in some way or other .
text_tokenized: Four - and - twenty hours had never passed before , since August began , without bringing them together in some way or other .

text: It was a sad , anxious day ; and the morrow , though differing in the sort of evil , did by no means bring less .
text_tokenized: It was a sad , anxious day ; and the morrow , though differing in the sort of evil , did by no means bring less .

text: A few moments of feverish enjoyment were followed by hours of acute suffering .
text_tokenized: A few moments of feverish enjoyment were followed by hours of acute suffering .

text: Henry Crawford was again in the house : he walked up with Dr. Grant , who was anxious to pay his respects to Sir Thomas , and at rather an early hour they were ushered into the breakfast - room , where were most of the family .
text_tokenized: Henry Crawford was again in the house : he walked up with Dr. Grant , who was anxious to pay his respects to Sir Thomas , and at rather an early hour they were ushered into the breakfast - room , where were most of the family .

text: Sir Thomas soon appeared , and Maria saw with delight and agitation the introduction of the man she loved to her father .
text_tokenized: Sir Thomas soon appeared , and Maria saw with delight and agitation the introduction of the man she loved to her father .

text: Her sensations were indefinable , and so were they a few minutes afterwards upon hearing Henry Crawford , who had a chair between herself and Tom , ask the latter in an undervoice whether there were any plans for resuming the play after the present happy interruption ( with a courteous glance at Sir Thomas ) , because , in that case , he should make a point of returning to Mansfield at any time required by the party : he was going away immediately , being to meet his uncle at Bath without delay ; but if there were any prospect of a renewal of Lovers ’ Vows , he should hold himself positively engaged , he should break through every other claim , he should absolutely condition with his uncle for attending them whenever he might be wanted .
text_tokenized: Her sensations were indefinable , and so were they a few minutes afterwards upon hearing Henry Crawford , who had a chair between herself and Tom , ask the latter in an undervoice whether there were any plans for resuming the play after the present happy interruption ( with a courteous glance at Sir Thomas ) , because , in that case , he should make a point of returning to Mansfield at any time required by the party : he was going away immediately , being to meet his uncle at Bath without delay ; but if there were any prospect of a renewal of Lovers ’ Vows , he should hold himself positively engaged , he should break through every other claim , he should absolutely condition with his uncle for attending them whenever he might be wanted .

text: The play should not be lost by _ his _ absence .
text_tokenized: The play should not be lost by _ his _ absence .

text: “ From Bath , Norfolk , London , York , wherever I may be , ” said he ; “ I will attend you from any place in England , at an hour ’s notice . ” It was well at that moment that Tom had to speak , and not his sister .

text: She had not long to endure what arose from listening to language which his actions contradicted , or to bury the tumult of her feelings under the restraint of society ; for general civilities soon called his notice from her , and the farewell visit , as it then became openly acknowledged , was a very short one .
text_tokenized: She had not long to endure what arose from listening to language which his actions contradicted , or to bury the tumult of her feelings under the restraint of society ; for general civilities soon called his notice from her , and the farewell visit , as it then became openly acknowledged , was a very short one .

text: He was gone — he had touched her hand for the last time , he had made his parting bow , and she might seek directly all that solitude could do for her . Henry Crawford was gone , gone from the house , and within two hours afterwards from the parish ; and so ended all the hopes his selfish vanity had raised in Maria and Julia Bertram .
text_tokenized: He was gone — he had touched her hand for the last time , he had made his parting bow , and she might seek directly all that solitude could do for her . Henry Crawford was gone , gone from the house , and within two hours afterwards from the parish ; and so ended all the hopes his selfish vanity had raised in Maria and Julia Bertram .

text: Julia could rejoice that he was gone .

text: Mrs. Norris began to look about her , and wonder that his falling in love with Julia had come to nothing ; and could almost fear that she had been remiss herself in forwarding it ; but with so many to care for , how was it possible for even _ her _ activity to keep pace with her wishes ?

text: Another day or two , and Mr. Yates was gone likewise .
text_tokenized: Another day or two , and Mr. Yates was gone likewise .

text: In _ his _ departure Sir Thomas felt the chief interest : wanting to be alone with his family , the presence of a stranger superior to Mr. Yates must have been irksome ; but of him , trifling and confident , idle and expensive , it was every way vexatious .
text_tokenized: In _ his _ departure Sir Thomas felt the chief interest : wanting to be alone with his family , the presence of a stranger superior to Mr. Yates must have been irksome ; but of him , trifling and confident , idle and expensive , it was every way vexatious .

text: In himself he was wearisome , but as the friend of Tom and the admirer of Julia he became offensive .
text_tokenized: In himself he was wearisome , but as the friend of Tom and the admirer of Julia he became offensive .

text: Sir Thomas had been quite indifferent to Mr. Crawford ’s going or staying : but his good wishes for Mr. Yates ’s having a pleasant journey , as he walked with him to the hall - door , were given with genuine satisfaction .
text_tokenized: Sir Thomas had been quite indifferent to Mr. Crawford ’s going or staying : but his good wishes for Mr. Yates ’s having a pleasant journey , as he walked with him to the hall - door , were given with genuine satisfaction .

text: Mr. Yates had staid to see the destruction of every theatrical preparation at Mansfield , the removal of everything appertaining to the play : he left the house in all the soberness of its general character ; and

text: Sir Thomas ’s return made a striking change in the ways of the family , independent of Lovers ’ Vows .
text_tokenized: Sir Thomas ’s return made a striking change in the ways of the family , independent of Lovers ’ Vows .

text: Under his government , Mansfield was an altered place .
text_tokenized: Under his government , Mansfield was an altered place .

text: Some members of their society sent away , and the spirits of many others saddened — it was all sameness and gloom compared with the past — a sombre family party rarely enlivened .
text_tokenized: Some members of their society sent away , and the spirits of many others saddened — it was all sameness and gloom compared with the past — a sombre family party rarely enlivened .

text: There was little intercourse with the Parsonage .
text_tokenized: There was little intercourse with the Parsonage .

text: Sir Thomas , drawing back from intimacies in general , was particularly disinclined , at this time , for any engagements but in one quarter .
text_tokenized: Sir Thomas , drawing back from intimacies in general , was particularly disinclined , at this time , for any engagements but in one quarter .

text: The Rushworths were the only addition to his own domestic circle which he could solicit .
text_tokenized: The Rushworths were the only addition to his own domestic circle which he could solicit .

text: Edmund did not wonder that such should be his father ’s feelings , nor could he regret anything but the exclusion of the Grants .
text_tokenized: Edmund did not wonder that such should be his father ’s feelings , nor could he regret anything but the exclusion of the Grants .

text: “ But they , ” he observed to Fanny , “ have a claim .
text_tokenized: “ But they , ” he observed to Fanny , “ have a claim .

text_tokenized: They seem to belong to us ; they

text: seem to be part of ourselves .
text_tokenized: seem to be part of ourselves .

text: I could wish my father were more sensible of their very great attention to my mother and sisters while he was away .
text_tokenized: I could wish my father were more sensible of their very great attention to my mother and sisters while he was away .

text: I am afraid they may feel themselves neglected .
text_tokenized: I am afraid they may feel themselves neglected .

text: But the truth is , that my father hardly knows them .
text_tokenized: But the truth is , that my father hardly knows them .

text: They had not been here a twelvemonth when he left England .
text_tokenized: They had not been here a twelvemonth when he left England .

text: If he knew them better , he would value their society as it deserves ; for they are in fact exactly the sort of people he would like .
text_tokenized: If he knew them better , he would value their society as it deserves ; for they are in fact exactly the sort of people he would like .

text: We are sometimes a little in want of animation among ourselves : my sisters seem out of spirits , and Tom is certainly not at his ease .
text_tokenized: We are sometimes a little in want of animation among ourselves : my sisters seem out of spirits , and Tom is certainly not at his ease .

text: Dr. and Mrs. Grant would enliven us , and make our evenings pass away with more enjoyment even to my father .
text_tokenized: Dr. and Mrs. Grant would enliven us , and make our evenings pass away with more enjoyment even to my father .

text: “ Do you think so ? ” said Fanny : “ in my opinion , my uncle would not like _ any _ addition .
text_tokenized: “ Do you think so ? ” said Fanny : “ in my opinion , my uncle would not like _ any _ addition .

text: I think he values the very quietness you speak of , and that the repose of his own family circle is all he wants .
text_tokenized: I think he values the very quietness you speak of , and that the repose of his own family circle is all he wants .

text: And it does not appear to me that we are more serious than we used to be — I mean before my uncle went abroad .
text_tokenized: And it does not appear to me that we are more serious than we used to be — I mean before my uncle went abroad .

text: As well as I can recollect , it was always much the same .
text_tokenized: As well as I can recollect , it was always much the same .

text: There was never much laughing in his presence ; or , if there is any difference , it is not more , I think , than such an absence has a tendency to produce at first .
text_tokenized: There was never much laughing in his presence ; or , if there is any difference , it is not more , I think , than such an absence has a tendency to produce at first .

text_tokenized: There must be a sort of shyness ;

text_tokenized: “ I believe our evenings are rather returned to what they were , than assuming a new character .

text_tokenized: Yet , how strong the impression that only a few weeks will give !

text_tokenized: “ The evenings do not appear long to me .

text_tokenized: I could listen to him for an hour together .

text: It entertains _ me _ more than many other things have done ; but then I am unlike other people , I dare say . ”
text_tokenized: It entertains _ me _ more than many other things have done ; but then I am unlike other people , I dare say . ”

text: “ Why should you dare say _ that _ ? ” ( smiling ) .
text_tokenized: “ Why should you dare say _ that _ ? ” ( smiling ) .

text: “ Do you want to be told that you are only unlike other people in being more wise and discreet ?
text_tokenized: “ Do you want to be told that you are only unlike other people in being more wise and discreet ?

text: But when did you , or anybody , ever get a compliment from me , Fanny ?
text_tokenized: But when did you , or anybody , ever get a compliment from me , Fanny ?

text: Go to my father if you want to be complimented .
text_tokenized: Go to my father if you want to be complimented .

text_tokenized: Ask your uncle what he thinks , and you will hear compliments enough : and

text: though they may be chiefly on your person , you must put up with it , and trust to his seeing as much beauty of mind in time . ” Such language was so new to Fanny that it quite embarrassed her . “ Your uncle thinks you very pretty , dear Fanny — and that is the long and the short of the matter .

text: Anybody but myself would have made something more of it , and anybody but you would resent that you had not been thought very pretty before ; but the truth is , that your uncle never did admire you till now — and now he does .

text_tokenized: Your complexion is so improved!—and you have gained so much countenance!—and your figure

text_tokenized: If you can not bear an uncle ’s admiration

text_tokenized: You must try not to mind growing up into a pretty woman .

text_tokenized: “ Oh !

text_tokenized: I only wish you would talk to him more .

text: You are one of those who are too silent in the evening circle . ”
text_tokenized: You are one of those who are too silent in the evening circle . ”

text_tokenized: “ But I do talk to him more than I used .

text: Did not you hear me ask him about the slave - trade last night ? ”
text_tokenized: Did not you hear me ask him about the slave - trade last night ? ”

text: It would have pleased your uncle to be inquired of farther . ”
text_tokenized: It would have pleased your uncle to be inquired of farther . ”

text: “ And I longed to do it — but there was such a dead silence !
text_tokenized: “ And I longed to do it — but there was such a dead silence !

text: And while my cousins were sitting by without speaking a word , or seeming at all interested in the subject , I did not like — I thought it would appear as if I wanted to set myself off at their expense , by shewing a curiosity and pleasure in his information which he must wish his own daughters to feel . ”

text: “ Miss Crawford was very right in what she said of you the other day : that you seemed almost as fearful of notice and praise as other women were of neglect .
text_tokenized: “ Miss Crawford was very right in what she said of you the other day : that you seemed almost as fearful of notice and praise as other women were of neglect .

text: We were talking of you at the Parsonage , and those were her words .
text_tokenized: We were talking of you at the Parsonage , and those were her words .

text: She has great discernment .
text_tokenized: She has great discernment .

text: I know nobody who distinguishes characters better .
text_tokenized: I know nobody who distinguishes characters better .

text: For so young a woman it is remarkable !
text_tokenized: For so young a woman it is remarkable !

text: She certainly understands _ you _ better than you are understood by the greater part of those who have known you so long ; and with regard to some others , I can perceive , from occasional lively hints , the unguarded expressions of the moment , that she could define _ many _ as accurately , did not delicacy forbid it .
text_tokenized: She certainly understands _ you _ better than you are understood by the greater part of those who have known you so long ; and with regard to some others , I can perceive , from occasional lively hints , the unguarded expressions of the moment , that she could define _ many _ as accurately , did not delicacy forbid it .

text: I wonder what she thinks of my father !
text_tokenized: I wonder what she thinks of my father !

text: She must admire him as a fine - looking man , with most gentlemanlike , dignified , consistent manners ; but perhaps , having seen him so seldom , his reserve may be a little repulsive .
text_tokenized: She must admire him as a fine - looking man , with most gentlemanlike , dignified , consistent manners ; but perhaps , having seen him so seldom , his reserve may be a little repulsive .

text: Could they be much together , I feel sure of their liking each other .
text_tokenized: Could they be much together , I feel sure of their liking each other .

text: He would enjoy her liveliness and she has talents to value his powers .
text_tokenized: He would enjoy her liveliness and she has talents to value his powers .

text: I wish they met more frequently !
text_tokenized: I wish they met more frequently !

text: I hope she does not suppose there is any dislike on his side . ”
text_tokenized: I hope she does not suppose there is any dislike on his side . ”

text: “ She must know herself too secure of the regard of all the rest of you , ” said Fanny , with half a sigh , “ to have any such apprehension .
text_tokenized: “ She must know herself too secure of the regard of all the rest of you , ” said Fanny , with half a sigh , “ to have any such apprehension .

text: And Sir Thomas ’s wishing just at first to be only with his family , is so very natural , that she can argue nothing from that .
text_tokenized: And Sir Thomas ’s wishing just at first to be only with his family , is so very natural , that she can argue nothing from that .

text: “ This is the first October that she has passed in the country since her infancy .
text_tokenized: “ This is the first October that she has passed in the country since her infancy .

text: I do not call Tunbridge or Cheltenham the country ; and November is a still more serious month , and I can see that Mrs. Grant is very anxious for her not finding Mansfield dull as winter comes on . ” Fanny could have said a great deal , but it was safer to say nothing , and leave untouched all Miss Crawford ’s resources — her accomplishments , her spirits , her importance , her friends , lest it should betray her into any observations seemingly unhandsome .

text: “ To - morrow , I think , my uncle dines at Sotherton , and you and Mr. Bertram too .

text_tokenized: We shall be quite a small party at home .

text_tokenized: I hope my uncle may continue to like Mr. Rushworth . ”

text_tokenized: “ That is impossible , Fanny .

text_tokenized: He must like him less after to - morrow ’s visit , for we shall be five hours in his company .

text_tokenized: He can not much longer deceive himself .

text_tokenized: I am sorry for them all , and would give something that Rushworth and Maria had never met . ” In this quarter , indeed , disappointment was impending over Sir Thomas .

text: Not all his good - will for Mr. Rushworth , not all Mr. Rushworth ’s deference for him , could prevent him from soon discerning some part of the truth — that Mr. Rushworth was an inferior young man , as ignorant in business as in books , with opinions in general unfixed , and without seeming much aware of it himself .

text: resolved to speak seriously to her .
text_tokenized: resolved to speak seriously to her .

text: Advantageous as would be the alliance , and long standing and public as was the engagement , her happiness must not be sacrificed to it .
text_tokenized: Advantageous as would be the alliance , and long standing and public as was the engagement , her happiness must not be sacrificed to it .

text: Mr. Rushworth had , perhaps , been accepted on too short an acquaintance , and , on knowing him better , she was repenting .
text_tokenized: Mr. Rushworth had , perhaps , been accepted on too short an acquaintance , and , on knowing him better , she was repenting .

text: With solemn kindness Sir Thomas addressed her : told her his fears , inquired into her wishes , entreated her to be open and sincere , and assured her that every inconvenience should be braved , and the connexion entirely given up , if she felt herself unhappy in the prospect of it .
text_tokenized: With solemn kindness Sir Thomas addressed her : told her his fears , inquired into her wishes , entreated her to be open and sincere , and assured her that every inconvenience should be braved , and the connexion entirely given up , if she felt herself unhappy in the prospect of it .

text: He would act for her and release her .
text_tokenized: He would act for her and release her .

text: Maria had a moment ’s struggle as she listened , and only a moment ’s : when her father ceased , she was able to give her answer immediately , decidedly , and with no apparent agitation .
text_tokenized: Maria had a moment ’s struggle as she listened , and only a moment ’s : when her father ceased , she was able to give her answer immediately , decidedly , and with no apparent agitation .

text: She thanked him for his great attention , his paternal kindness , but he was quite mistaken in supposing she had the smallest desire of breaking through her engagement , or was sensible of any change of opinion or inclination since her forming it .
text_tokenized: She thanked him for his great attention , his paternal kindness , but he was quite mistaken in supposing she had the smallest desire of breaking through her engagement , or was sensible of any change of opinion or inclination since her forming it .

text_tokenized: She had the highest esteem for Mr. Rushworth ’s character and disposition , and could not have a doubt of her happiness with him .

text_tokenized: It was an alliance which he could not have relinquished without pain ; and thus he reasoned .

text: Mr. Rushworth was young enough to improve .
text_tokenized: Mr. Rushworth was young enough to improve .

text: Mr. Rushworth must and would improve in good society ; and if Maria could now speak so securely of her happiness with him , speaking certainly without the prejudice , the blindness of love , she ought to be believed .
text_tokenized: Mr. Rushworth must and would improve in good society ; and if Maria could now speak so securely of her happiness with him , speaking certainly without the prejudice , the blindness of love , she ought to be believed .

text_tokenized: Her feelings , probably , were not acute ; he had never supposed them to be so ; but her comforts might not be less on that account ; and if she could dispense with seeing her husband a leading , shining character

text: A well - disposed young woman , who did not marry for love , was in general but the more attached to her own family ; and the nearness of Sotherton to Mansfield must naturally hold out the greatest temptation , and would , in all probability , be a continual supply of the most amiable and innocent enjoyments .

text: Such and such - like were the reasonings of Sir Thomas , happy to escape the embarrassing evils of a rupture , the wonder , the reflections , the reproach that must attend it ; happy to secure a marriage which would bring him such an addition of respectability and influence , and very happy to think anything of his daughter ’s disposition that was most favourable for the purpose .
text_tokenized: Such and such - like were the reasonings of Sir Thomas , happy to escape the embarrassing evils of a rupture , the wonder , the reflections , the reproach that must attend it ; happy to secure a marriage which would bring him such an addition of respectability and influence , and very happy to think anything of his daughter ’s disposition that was most favourable for the purpose .

text: To her the conference closed as satisfactorily as to him .
text_tokenized: To her the conference closed as satisfactorily as to him .

text: She was in a state of mind to be glad that she had secured her fate beyond recall : that she had pledged herself anew to Sotherton ; that she was safe from the possibility of giving Crawford the triumph of governing her actions , and destroying her prospects ; and retired in proud resolve , determined only to behave more cautiously to Mr. Rushworth in future , that her father might not be again suspecting her .
text_tokenized: She was in a state of mind to be glad that she had secured her fate beyond recall : that she had pledged herself anew to Sotherton ; that she was safe from the possibility of giving Crawford the triumph of governing her actions , and destroying her prospects ; and retired in proud resolve , determined only to behave more cautiously to Mr. Rushworth in future , that her father might not be again suspecting her .

text: Had Sir Thomas applied to his daughter within the first three or four days after Henry Crawford ’s leaving Mansfield , before her feelings were at all tranquillised , before she had given up every hope of him , or absolutely resolved on enduring his rival , her answer might have been different ; but after another three or four days , when there was no return , no letter , no message , no symptom of a softened heart , no hope of advantage from separation , her mind became cool enough to seek all the comfort that pride and self revenge could give .
text_tokenized: Had Sir Thomas applied to his daughter within the first three or four days after Henry Crawford ’s leaving Mansfield , before her feelings were at all tranquillised , before she had given up every hope of him , or absolutely resolved on enduring his rival , her answer might have been different ; but after another three or four days , when there was no return , no letter , no message , no symptom of a softened heart , no hope of advantage from separation , her mind became cool enough to seek all the comfort that pride and self revenge could give .

text: Henry Crawford had destroyed her happiness , but he should not know that he had done it ; he should not destroy her credit , her appearance , her prosperity , too .
text_tokenized: Henry Crawford had destroyed her happiness , but he should not know that he had done it ; he should not destroy her credit , her appearance , her prosperity , too .

text: He should not have to think of her as pining in the retirement of Mansfield for _ him _ , rejecting Sotherton and London , independence and splendour , for _ his _ sake .
text_tokenized: He should not have to think of her as pining in the retirement of Mansfield for _ him _ , rejecting Sotherton and London , independence and splendour , for _ his _ sake .

text: Independence was more needful than ever ; the want of it at Mansfield more sensibly felt .
text_tokenized: Independence was more needful than ever ; the want of it at Mansfield more sensibly felt .

text: She was less and less able to endure the restraint which her father imposed .
text_tokenized: She was less and less able to endure the restraint which her father imposed .

text: The liberty which his absence had given was now become absolutely necessary .
text_tokenized: The liberty which his absence had given was now become absolutely necessary .

text: She must escape from him and Mansfield as soon as possible , and find consolation in fortune and consequence , bustle and the world , for a wounded spirit .
text_tokenized: She must escape from him and Mansfield as soon as possible , and find consolation in fortune and consequence , bustle and the world , for a wounded spirit .

text: Her mind was quite determined , and varied not .
text_tokenized: Her mind was quite determined , and varied not .

text: To such feelings delay , even the delay of much preparation , would have been an evil , and Mr. Rushworth could hardly be more impatient for the marriage than herself .
text_tokenized: To such feelings delay , even the delay of much preparation , would have been an evil , and Mr. Rushworth could hardly be more impatient for the marriage than herself .

text: In all the important preparations of the mind she was complete : being prepared for matrimony by an hatred of home , restraint , and tranquillity ; by the misery of disappointed affection , and contempt of the man she was to marry .
text_tokenized: In all the important preparations of the mind she was complete : being prepared for matrimony by an hatred of home , restraint , and tranquillity ; by the misery of disappointed affection , and contempt of the man she was to marry .

text: The rest might wait .
text_tokenized: The rest might wait .

text: The preparations of new carriages and furniture might wait for London and spring , when her own taste could have fairer play . The principals being all agreed in this respect , it soon appeared that a very few weeks would be sufficient for such arrangements as must precede the wedding .
text_tokenized: The preparations of new carriages and furniture might wait for London and spring , when her own taste could have fairer play . The principals being all agreed in this respect , it soon appeared that a very few weeks would be sufficient for such arrangements as must precede the wedding .

text: Mrs. Rushworth was quite ready to retire , and make way for the fortunate young woman whom her dear son had selected ; and very early in November removed herself , her maid , her footman , and her chariot , with true dowager propriety , to Bath , there to parade over the wonders of Sotherton in her evening parties ; enjoying them as thoroughly , perhaps , in the animation of a card - table , as she had ever done on the spot ; and before the middle of the same month the ceremony had taken place which gave Sotherton another mistress .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Rushworth was quite ready to retire , and make way for the fortunate young woman whom her dear son had selected ; and very early in November removed herself , her maid , her footman , and her chariot , with true dowager propriety , to Bath , there to parade over the wonders of Sotherton in her evening parties ; enjoying them as thoroughly , perhaps , in the animation of a card - table , as she had ever done on the spot ; and before the middle of the same month the ceremony had taken place which gave Sotherton another mistress .

text: It was a very proper wedding .
text_tokenized: It was a very proper wedding .

text: The bride was elegantly dressed ; the two bridesmaids were duly inferior ; her father gave her away ; her mother stood with salts in her hand , expecting to be agitated ; her aunt tried to cry ; and the service was impressively read by Dr. Grant .
text_tokenized: The bride was elegantly dressed ; the two bridesmaids were duly inferior ; her father gave her away ; her mother stood with salts in her hand , expecting to be agitated ; her aunt tried to cry ; and the service was impressively read by Dr. Grant .

text: Nothing could be objected to when it came under the discussion of the neighbourhood , except that the carriage which conveyed the bride and bridegroom and Julia from the church - door to Sotherton was the same chaise which Mr. Rushworth had used for a twelvemonth before .
text_tokenized: Nothing could be objected to when it came under the discussion of the neighbourhood , except that the carriage which conveyed the bride and bridegroom and Julia from the church - door to Sotherton was the same chaise which Mr. Rushworth had used for a twelvemonth before .

text: In everything else the etiquette of the day might stand the strictest investigation .
text_tokenized: In everything else the etiquette of the day might stand the strictest investigation .

text: It was done , and they were gone .
text_tokenized: It was done , and they were gone .

text: Sir Thomas felt as an anxious father must feel , and was indeed experiencing much of the agitation which his wife had been apprehensive of for herself , but had fortunately escaped .
text_tokenized: Sir Thomas felt as an anxious father must feel , and was indeed experiencing much of the agitation which his wife had been apprehensive of for herself , but had fortunately escaped .

text: Mrs. Norris , most happy to assist in the duties of the day , by spending it at the Park to support her sister ’s spirits , and drinking the health of Mr. and Mrs. Rushworth in a supernumerary glass or two , was all joyous delight ; for she had made the match ; she had done everything ; and no one would have supposed , from her confident triumph , that she had ever heard of conjugal infelicity in her life , or could have the

text: The plan of the young couple was to proceed , after a few days , to Brighton , and take a house there for some weeks .
text_tokenized: The plan of the young couple was to proceed , after a few days , to Brighton , and take a house there for some weeks .

text: Every public place was new to Maria , and Brighton is almost as gay in winter as in summer .
text_tokenized: Every public place was new to Maria , and Brighton is almost as gay in winter as in summer .

text: When the novelty of amusement there was over , it would be time for the wider range of London . Julia was to go with them to Brighton .
text_tokenized: When the novelty of amusement there was over , it would be time for the wider range of London . Julia was to go with them to Brighton .

text: Since rivalry between the sisters had ceased , they had been gradually recovering much of their former good understanding ; and were at least sufficiently friends to make each of them exceedingly glad to be with the other at such a time .
text_tokenized: Since rivalry between the sisters had ceased , they had been gradually recovering much of their former good understanding ; and were at least sufficiently friends to make each of them exceedingly glad to be with the other at such a time .

text: Some other companion than Mr. Rushworth was of the first consequence to his lady ; and Julia was quite as eager for novelty and pleasure as Maria , though she might not have struggled through so much to obtain them , and could better bear a subordinate situation .
text_tokenized: Some other companion than Mr. Rushworth was of the first consequence to his lady ; and Julia was quite as eager for novelty and pleasure as Maria , though she might not have struggled through so much to obtain them , and could better bear a subordinate situation .

text: Their departure made another material change at Mansfield , a chasm which required some time to fill up .
text_tokenized: Their departure made another material change at Mansfield , a chasm which required some time to fill up .

text: The family circle became greatly contracted ; and though the Miss Bertrams had latterly added little to its gaiety , they could not but be missed .
text_tokenized: The family circle became greatly contracted ; and though the Miss Bertrams had latterly added little to its gaiety , they could not but be missed .

text: Even their mother missed them ; and how much more their tenderhearted cousin , who wandered about the house , and thought of them , and felt for them , with a degree of affectionate regret which they had never done much to deserve !
text_tokenized: Even their mother missed them ; and how much more their tenderhearted cousin , who wandered about the house , and thought of them , and felt for them , with a degree of affectionate regret which they had never done much to deserve !
